content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can define a function `clean_column` to clean column names as follows:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the string
    str = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespace
    str = strip(str)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    str = replace(str, " " => "_")
    str = replace(str, "-" => "_")
    
    return str
end
```

This function takes a `String` as input (`col`) and returns the cleaned column name. It first lowercases the string, then strips any leading or trailing whitespace, and finally replaces spaces and hyphens with underscores.

You can call this function on individual strings or use it within more complex data manipulation tasks involving dataframes or arrays.
